elements.title: Ko Myo Shin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that legend has it that Ko Myo Shin (statue pictured) became a spirit after allowing his head to be cut off?

elements.title: Damaris Gelabert (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the children's music singer Damaris Gelabert was the first Catalan music channel on YouTube to win a Silver Button?

elements.title: a 2025 ecclesiastical trial (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a 2025 ecclesiastical trial had three successive prosecutors during its first three weeks?

elements.title: Enrique Molina Pico (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Argentine admiral Enrique Molina Pico commanded the destroyer ARA Hércules during the Falklands War, and later coordinated the operations of Argentine forces in the Gulf War?

elements.title: The Taverna (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the film The Taverna was shot at a Greek restaurant in Melbourne over sixteen days?

elements.title: Kelley Dolphus Stroud (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Kelley Dolphus Stroud hitchhiked from Colorado Springs to Boston in twelve days to compete in the 1928 United States Olympic trials?

elements.title: Edward D. Maryon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Edward D. Maryon's art was heavily influenced by his time stationed at the Presidio of Monterey after being drafted into the army?

elements.title: Zachary Fisk (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that condensed-matter physicist Zachary Fisk conducted chemistry experiments in secret because his father disapproved of his interest?

elements.title: 2023 Formula One World Drivers' Championship (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Max Verstappen won a record 19 Grands Prix in a season on his way to the 2023 Formula One World Drivers' Championship?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

San Carlos de Bariloche

The Argentine adventure capital offers great opportunities for skiing, sightseeing, water sports, trekking and climbing amidst the amazing mountainous landscapes of Argentine Patagonia.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Sekigahara

This quaint mountain town and battlefield, where Tokugawa won control of Japan, gives visitors firsthand insight into feudal Japanese warfare.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

Driving in China

China isn't one of the countries that foreigners commonly explore by driving themselves. If you'd still like to, the first step would be getting a local driving licence.
